thread.title: NKU men's basketball picked last in Horizon League
thread.title_full: NKU men's basketball picked last in Horizon League

title: NKU men's basketball picked last in Horizon League
text:
NKU men's basketball picked last in Horizon League 
Updated: Wed, Oct 14 2015, 05:18 PM 
CINCINNATI (WKRC) -- The Horizon League conference office released its men's basketball preseason conference poll and all-conference teams as voted on by the coaches, sports information directors and members of the media, and Northern Kentucky University was selected to finish 10th of 10 teams in the poll.Valparaiso topped the league poll with 418 points. Oakland was second with 368 points and was closely followed by Milwaukee’s 344 in third. Youngstown State was picked to finish ninth, just ahead of NKU by six points.Oakland’s Kahlil Felder was tabbed as the preseason player of the year and highlighted the first team all-conference list.NKU returns 61 percent of its scoring from last season’s team, including seniors Jalen Billups and Tyler White. Billups was the nation’s leader in field-goal shooting at 69.6 percent last year, and averaged 11.1 points per game to go along with 5.9 rebounds per game. White closed the season with three-straight 19-point efforts to finish the year averaging 10.2 points.John Brannen begins his first season guiding the Norse following 17-years as an assistant at Alabama, VCU, St. Bonaventure, Eastern Kentucky and Charleston. The Northern Kentucky native, who was a standout player at Newport Central Catholic High School, most recently led Alabama to a 1-1 mark in the NIT as interim head coach before coming home to take the helm at NKU.NKU fans can get their first glimpse at the 2015-16 team on Nov. 7 when Northern Kentucky hosts Ohio Northern in an exhibition contest. The regular season begins on Nov. 13 at West Virginia. PRESEASON POLL
